events.description: The cartoonist, Winsor McCay, brings the Dinosaurus back to life in the figure of his latest creation, Gertie the Dinosaur.
events.title: Gertie the Dinosaur

events.description: A woman, with the aid of her police officer sweetheart, endeavors to uncover the prostitution ring that has kidnapped her sister, and the philanthropist who secretly runs it.
events.title: Traffic in Souls

events.plot: A group of bandits stage a brazen train hold-up, only to find a determined posse hot on their heels.
events.title: The Great Train Robbery

events.description: A kept woman runs into her one-time fiancè and finds herself torn between love and comfort.
events.title: A Woman of Paris: A Drama of Fate

events.description: A bitter clown endeavors to rescue the young woman he loves from the lecherous count who once betrayed him.
events.title: He Who Gets Slapped

events.description: Millie Stope lives with her grandfather on a remote island. Her grandfather fled there for political reasons. But they're not alone. An escaped prisoner, Nicholas, is terrorizing them, and ...
events.title: Wild Oranges

events.description: A professional clown and a self-indulgent count learn to help each other with their problems, but then become romantic rivals.
events.title: Laugh, Clown, Laugh

events.description: Harriet and Queenie Mahoney, a vaudeville act, come to Broadway, where their friend Eddie Kerns needs them for his number in one of Francis Zanfield's shows. Eddie was in love with Harriet,...
events.title: The Broadway Melody

events.description: A newly wedded couple attempt to build a house with a prefabricated kit, unaware that a rival sabotaged the kit's component numbering.
events.title: One Week

events.description: Nick Van Alstyne owns the Henrietta silver mine and is very rich. His son Bertie is naive and spoiled. His daughter Rose is married to shady investor Mark. Mark wrecks Bertie's wedding plans by making him take the blame for Mark's illegitimate daughter. Mark also nearly ruins the family business by selling off Henrietta stock at too low a price. Bertie, of all people, must come to the rescue on the trading floor.
events.title: The Saphead

events.description: An irresponsible young millionaire changes his tune when he falls for the daughter of a downtown minister.
events.title: For Heaven's Sake

events.description: The son of the sheik and a dancing girl fall in love, but when he is made to believe she has betrayed him he seeks revenge.
events.title: The Son of the Sheik

events.description: A convict falls in love with his new cellmate's sister, only to become embroiled in a planned break-out which is certain to have lethal consequences.
events.title: The Big House

events.description: Original advertising for the film describes it as a drama of primitive life on the shores of the North Pacific...
events.title: In the Land of the Head Hunters

events.description: Gwen's family is rich, but her parents ignore her and most of the servants push her around, so she is lonely and unhappy. Her father is concerned only with making money, and her mother ...
events.title: The Poor Little Rich Girl

events.description: Two peasant children, Mytyl and Tyltyl, are led by Berylune, a fairy, to search for the Blue Bird of Happiness. Berylune gives Tyltyl a cap with a diamond setting, and when Tyltyl turns the...
events.title: The Blue Bird

events.description: A romantic rivalry among members of a secret society becomes even tenser when one of the men is assigned to carry out an assassination.
events.title: The Ace of Hearts
Tol'able David
events.description: When three thuggish men are responsible for the death of his father and the crippling of his brother, young David must choose between supporting his family or risking his life and exacting vengeance.

events.title: Disraeli
events.description: Biopic of the famed British Prime Minister focusing on his concern about Russia's growing interest in the Indian subcontinent and his attempts to buy the Suez Canal. He sees the Canal as the key strategic resource in maintaining the Empire in the East but is unpopular in many quarters. With antisemitism rife at the time, Disraeli finds little support for his plan to purchase the canal or his foreign policy in general. There is no doubt that the Russians are plotting against British interests and he is surrounded by spies, even in his office at 10 Downing St. When the Bank of England refuses to finance the purchase of the available shares he turns to private sources to raise the available cash only to find the conspirators one step ahead of him.
